It has Cake :D

Like the appetizer before the entree (also known as the awesomeness that is Portal 2!!!).

The pros: It's challenging and fun, and worth a download for the humor alone. The voices of the robots are creeeeeepy (in a good way!).  The polite killer robots were hilarious.

The cons: I would have liked more story elements. I wanted to know who the person writing "Help" on all the walls was, and why the facility was built, and what the aims were of building the AI.  If you're not much bothered by story, I guess this would be the game for you.  For me, I wanted to know more, and a few secret areas wouldn't have hurt, either.  Gameplay was also quite short--for me, under 6 hours to play all the way through.

To sum up: definitely worth it, but Portal 2 is where it's at.
Portal 2 Is Better But This Is Still Amazing!!!! Best Game Ever, Valve!

Un juego entretenidisimo, con una jugabilidad muy original y didactica, historia bastante buena y uno de los mejores villanos en los videojuegos.

Lo unico que le encuentro malo es su duración, que si haces los puzzles de forma calmada, llegara a durar solo 5 horas.

 Pero en fin, OBRA MAESTRA.

Fantastic, original, very well designed puzzle game.  The graphics have held up for two subsequent generations.

Pros:
- Great graphics (for the time)
- Well optimized
- Love the humor
- Original, interesting plot
- Tough puzzles keep you thinking
- Voice acting is top-notch, for Chell especially

Cons:
- Much shorter than I expected (beat the game in 2 hours)
- That's pretty much it, I can't think of anything else

What are you waiting for?  Go play this game!

Different take on a normal puzzle game where the single thing you need is your gun. Blue. Orange. Blue and Orange. Creative game with a comical narrator with you along the ride. Story is very minimal as this game is rather short and can be beat within a hour or two.

Entertainment: 8 / 10
Controls: 9 / 10

Final Grade : C
Replay Value: Low

Portal
Gameplay: 9

With the difficulty gradient of an invigorating mountain hike, immersively paving the way into increasingly complex set pieces, the sheer experience of Portal is both engaging and satisfyingly challenging. The introduction of additional game elements over time expands on the basic concepts in a thought-provoking way without patronising the player. Whilst short and strikingly linear, this is a minor price for such high quality design and implementation. 

Narrative: 9

GlaDOS, our seemingly disembodied AI instructor, is a deeply imagined computer personality to rival any in even the best science fiction. As I'm moving cubes, circumventing turrets and opening portals, GlaDOS and the glitchiness of her communications unintentionally foreshadows future events in a darkly humorous and ironic way – and its not often you get to commend a game for effective use of dramatic irony. The suprisingly clever plot and wonderfully executed dialogue enhances immersion into the game and provides a satisfying experience as it plunges us ever deeper into its robust and claustraphobic world. 

Aesthetics: 9

As I have already hinted, the voice acting is fantastic. The industrial-scientific environments and objects are polished and make the most of the Source Engine to create an iconic style of turrets, cameras, doors and  rooms – cameras that creepily turn to face you as you enter the room. The technology certainly looks like it was designed by a single science and technology corporation and the sounds all neatly fit this schema – Portal's aesthetic is cohesive and clear, enabling us to quickly grasp game play elements and find out about the world we inhabit by exploration rather than exposition. An example of how a stylised and holistic aesthetic is better than raw graphical realism.

Overall: 9 

Portal provides an incredibly slick and satisfying experience and should be played by everyone with the capacity to play a video game. A virtually flawless few hours in an undervalued medium that ought to be considered part of the canon, if not its creme.

(Please note that I originally completed this game on the PS3 which is why I have only minutes of game time recorded on the PC).

I must say I enjoyed this game massively! The storyline has you confused at the start and begging for more at the end, and the overall gameplay is exellant! However, after playing Portal 2 and it taking over 15 hours for me to complete, I must admit I was dissapointed at how little time it took me to comp[lete this game. But since this was Valves first puzzle singliplayer game (excluding half life), it was an unbelivably fun game! 9/10, and well worth the money!

This is a great puzzle game with a mysterious yet interesting plot. The mechanics of the game are original and superb, and the platforming is great. While the game is short, it still provides more content beyond the story mode in the form of challenges for some of the past levels. This is definitely one of the best games that Steam has to offer.

プレイ時間はざっと4時間程度。時間だけ見るとものすごくすぐ終わっているようだけど実際はかなり長く遊んだ気がする。たぶん無駄なストーリーや会話などがないためプレイ時間が短くなっているのだろう。このゲームはFPSだけど銃も撃てないしスパナもない。「入り口と出口を作る銃」を使って入り口と出口を作ってステージをクリアしていくゲーム。単純なパズルだけではなく、高いところから飛び降りてすぐに入り口を作って遠くまで飛ぶというアクション要素もあり。かなり頭をつかう。個人的な話だがストレス病（うつ病）で通院中の僕には少々辛い頭脳戦もあったけど、なんとかクリアしたし面白かった。病気のせいで体調がすぐれず休み休みプレイしたのでたぶんクリアに1年くらいかかってる。このゲームに限らずVALVEのゲームはsteamでセーブデータが「クラウド」になっているので、パソコンのHDDを初期化してソフトを全部消してしまっても、再度steamでダウンロードするとセーブデータまでリストアしてくれるので良かった。
Incrivelmente Foda não há como negar, um dos melhores Jogos q ja joguei na vida,  Vale Cada centavo nesse jogo sem arrependimento 11/10

Probably my favorite game by Valve so far. I enjoy the character of GLaDOS as a villain so much. The puzzles are very interesting, and the portal gun is one of the coolest puzzle-solving tools out there. The design of the game has a nice feel of being open, but at the same time claustrophobic. And the ending is excellent (save a bit of a lag between the revelation and the actual boss battle. It felt like an hour.) This game will make you want to have a Portal Gun so bad, once you've finished this very... very short game.

Portal is an amazing game with its great level design and intersting characters. Using portals in a game was a great design desition on Valves part because it makes you have to think about the puzzels in a whole different way. Although there were very few, the characters felt funny and interesting whenever they were talking. My only critic is that the game is incredibly short althogh there's a sequel. I also think that it was a very bad design desition to make the protagonist silent witch is a trend that Valve will finnaly stop.

9/10 - It´s short

This was a triumph.
I'm making a note here: 
HUGE SUCCESS.
It's hard to overstate my satisfaction.

Aperture Science.
We do what we must because we can.
For the good of all of us
Except the ones who are dead.

But there's no sense crying over every mistake.
You just keep on trying till you run out of cake.
And the science gets done and you make a neat gun.
For the people who are still alive.

I'm not even angry.
I'm being so sincere right now.
Even though you broke my heart and killed me.
And tore me to pieces.
And threw every piece into a fire.
As they burned it hurt because
I was so happy for you!

Now these points of data make a beautiful line.
And we're out of beta, we're releasing on time.
So I'm GLaD I got burned.
Think of all the things we learned
For the people who are still alive.

Go ahead and leave me.
I think I prefer to stay inside.
Maybe you'll find someone else to help you.
Maybe Black Mesa...
THAT WAS A JOKE. Haha. FAT CHANCE.
Anyway, this cake is great.
It's so delicious and moist.

Look at me still talking when there's science to do.
When I look out there it makes me GLaD I'm not you.
I've experiments to run there is research to be done
On the people who are still alive

And believe me I am still alive.
I'm doing science and I'm still alive.
I feel FANTASTIC and I'm still alive.
While you're dying I'll be still alive.
And when you're dead I will be still alive.

Still alive
Still alive

Ah, good old Portal.  This game is a real gem.  First, a little background.  Portal is a humorous first-person puzzle game where you use a device called a Portal Gun to navigate and solve problems in a giant underground research facility belonging to a megacorporation called Aperture Laboratories.  You are Chell, a test subject for the Portal Gun, and your tests(puzzles) are overseen by an insane AI named GLaDOS(Genetic Lifeform and Disc Operating System).  Portal was my first game on Steam, and I am just now getting around to writing a review, so forgive me if I am not very good at this.  Without further ado, the pros and cons of Portal.

Pros:
+The whole premise of the game is brilliant.
+the controls are, for the most part, simple enough for most players.
+the actress playing GLaDOS has some really funny lines, I won't spoil them for you, but the acting and creative writing are dead on.
+the level design is extremely well thought out.

Cons:
-The graphics are old and haven't aged as well as other games.
-The plot is funny, but the game is short and there is a lack of depth in the story.  If you are like me, and love good plots, than Portal 2 is better.
-Test Chamber 17 is the most teary I have ever gotten because of a game.  I don't like tearjerkers.

In conclusion, the game is a very solid piece of work, and the good far outweighs the bad.  I would reccomend this to anyone looking for a great puzzle game and a hearty laugh.  Once again, thanks Valve for an awesome game.

9/10 Would submit for testing again.

I don't think you can talk about truly good games without mentioning Portal. It is the poineer "Steam Age" game that was most likely your first game on steam. An incredible, mind-bending, memorable experience that you won't be able to stop until you finish the whole game. I honestly haven't play a game since this one that has given me any similar experience, aside from Portal 2 I guess. This is perhaps Valve's magnum opus.

One of the few games that really gave a different gaming experience to me in recent years. Very brave to come up with this idea and pursue it to the end. Spectacular voice acting, excellent sound design and clever puzzles. A downside maybe is the gameplay time is a bit short.
